unnormalised: So, you're thinking about applying to a fancy Indian university, huh? Buckle up, buttercup, because it's less "finding your passion" and more "surviving the Hunger Games, academic edition." First off, you'll need a score in the 99.99th percentile on some entrance exam like the JEE or NEET. Don't even *think* about applying with a measly 99.98%. That’s like bringing a butter knife to a sword fight. Trust me, I’ve seen it.
normalised: So, you are thinking about applying to a fancy Indian university, huh? Buckle up, buttercup, because it is less "finding your passion" and more "surviving the Hunger Games, academic edition." First off, you will need a score in the ninety nine point nine nine-th percentile on some entrance exam like the J-E-E or N-E-E-T. Do not even think about applying with a measly ninety nine point nine eight percent. That is like bringing a butter knife to a sword fight. Trust me, I have seen it.

unnormalised: Then comes the document verification. Get ready to submit copies of your 10th and 12th mark sheets, transfer certificate, Aadhaar card, caste certificate (if applicable, and may the odds be ever in your favour!), and a photo that hasn’t been retouched more times than a Bollywood actress. They will scrutinize every single document, so make sure your name matches *exactly* across all IDs. One misplaced comma and *poof*, your application vanishes into the digital abyss. My friend Rakesh had his application rejected because his 10th marksheet said "Rakesh Kumar" and his Aadhar was under “Rakesh Kr.” Close, but no cigar.
normalised: Then comes the document verification. Get ready to submit copies of your tenth and twelfth mark sheets, transfer certificate, A-a-d-h-a-a-r card, caste certificate (if applicable, and may the odds be ever in your favour!), and a photo that has not been retouched more times than a Bollywood actress. They will scrutinize every single document, so make sure your name matches exactly across all I-D-s. One misplaced comma and poof, your application vanishes into the digital abyss. My friend Rakesh had his application rejected because his tenth marksheet said "Rakesh Kumar" and his Aadhar was under "Rakesh K-r." Close, but no cigar.

unnormalised: And then there’s the counseling round. This is where you get to play the exciting game of “guess which branch is actually available.” Prepare for endless scrolling through websites at 3 AM, desperately refreshing to see if a seat in Computer Science at IIT Delhi has magically opened up. It's like trying to snag the last piece of gulab jamun at a wedding; everyone's after it, and only one lucky soul will succeed. Keep refreshing and may the odds be ever in your favour. This is where you'll wish you prepone-d your admission counselling research.
normalised: And then there is the counseling round. This is where you get to play the exciting game of "guess which branch is actually available." Prepare for endless scrolling through websites at three A-M, desperately refreshing to see if a seat in Computer Science at I-I-T Delhi has magically opened up. It is like trying to snag the last piece of gulab jamun at a wedding; everyone is after it, and only one lucky soul will succeed. Keep refreshing and may the odds be ever in your favour. This is where you will wish you preponed your admission counselling research.

unnormalised: Oh, and don't forget the fees! Expect to shell out somewhere between Rs. 1 lakh to Rs. 5 lakh per year, depending on the university and course. If you're lucky, you might get a scholarship. If not, well, start selling your kidneys… or maybe just apply for an education loan at a bank. My uncle got his loan at 9.5% interest at SBI and is still paying it off. So plan well!
normalised: Oh, and do not forget the fees! Expect to shell out somewhere between rupee one lakh to rupee five lakh per year, depending on the university and course. If you are lucky, you might get a scholarship. If not, well, start selling your kidneys… or maybe just apply for an education loan at a bank. My uncle got his loan at nine point five percent interest at S-B-I and is still paying it off. So plan well!

unnormalised: But hey, if you survive all this, you'll get to wear the coveted IIT or AIIMS tag. Just remember, getting in is only half the battle. Now you actually have to *study*. Good luck, you crazy diamond! You'll need it. The final date for application closes on 30/06/2024, so get your skates on!
normalised: But hey, if you survive all this, you will get to wear the coveted I-I-T or A-I-I-M-S tag. Just remember, getting in is only half the battle. Now you actually have to study. Good luck, you crazy diamond! You will need it. The final date for application closes on thirtieth june two thousand and twenty four, so get your skates on!
